sub_topic: Prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is distributive over intersection.
message_1: Let A = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5} and B = {2, 4, 6, 8, 10}. Find the symmetric difference of (A ∩ B) and (A ∆ B). Show that the symmetric difference of (A ∩ B) and (A ∆ B) is distributive over intersection, i.e., prove that (A ∩ B) ∆ (A ∆ B) = (A ∩ B) ∆ (B ∩ A).
